nav.div: Farmington Municipal Schools » COVID-19 Updates and Info » Superintendent's Messages Regarding COVID-19

span.style: font-size: 20px;
span.strong: Para traducción del sitio Web del Distrito escolar de Farmington seleccione LANGUAGE en la parte superior izquierda de la pantalla y haga clic en la opción español.

span.style: font-size: 20px;

p.span: FMS Superintendent Dr. Eugene Schmidt aims to update students, staff, families and the Farmington community regularly during this school closure due to Coronavirus (COVID-19). Dr. Schmidt's most recent message is displayed below. Updated messages are emailed to parents and then posted here.

span.style: font-size: 20px; font-size: 20px;
font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: Farmington Municipal Schools students, families, staff and community,

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: I often start these letters with a reminder to take care of ourselves and each other. I begin with this reminder again because it is possibly the most important reminder of all. Taking care of each other, of our students and ourselves will have a large impact on our community weathering this storm. There are resources available and are listed on our

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . Our local hospital, San Juan Regional Medical Center also suggests

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: for talking with children about Coronavirus.

span.style: font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: As I touched on yesterday, uncertainties surround us at this time especially in regards to economics. However, there is a concrete task we can all complete to ensure our district received funding it needs. Completing the Census is a critical action all FMS families can take during this closure to achieve an accurate count for our County. The Census provides data that determines funding for federal programs and others for the next 10 years, with each person accounting for almost $5,000 every year. Families can respond

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . In addition, both primary and general elections will occur this year. This is a reminder to students who will be 18 before Election Day in November to register to vote at this

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . Those already registered can also request an absentee ballot to vote from the comfort of your home

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . Information about local elections and more can also be found at the

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; text-indent: 36pt; white-space: pre; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: With every day, an increased amount of uncertainty seems to enter our lives. Today, most of the talk was about the price of oil, which for those who might not be following the news the price of oil to a steep drop in value. As oil and gas tax revenue provides funds for public education in New Mexico, this drop in value has the potential of upsetting the budget forecast for New Mexico even more. FMS administration and the FMS Board of Education continues to monitor potential budget changes and prepare for a multitude of possibilities. As a reminder, the FMS Board will meet virtually on Thursday, April 23. The agenda for the meeting and a link to join virtually can be found

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: Before offering you highlights of great work around our district, I’d like to recognize Piedra Vista High School, who was recently recognized as

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: ranked in the top 40% of high schools in the nation, a group of more than 18,000 high schools, by

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: I offer this congratulatory message to Principal Kelly Thur, his administration, staff, faculty and most importantly PV students on behalf of the entire FMS district. Way to go Panthers!

span.style: font-size: 20px;
text-indent: 36pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: Our Student Nutrition and Food Service Departments continue to serve students through this closure while maintaining a high level of attention on procedures for the safety of our staff as well as students and families who utilize these services. Yesterday, local Girl Scout Troop #10627 left encouraging and thankful messages for those essential employees working at Central Kitchen. It was a kind gesture that did not go unnoticed by our staff. In addition to this act of kindness, Domino’s Pizza has graciously donated pizza for the hot lunch pick-up sites to serve this Friday. One slice of pizza will be served to each student at the eight sites, which are listed

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
text-indent: 36pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . Thank you Girl Scout Troop #10627, Domino’s Pizza and our community at large for your continued support of our district.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: With the cancellation of school events like moving on ceremonies, McKinley Elementary staff and PTA began distributing yard signs to recognize fifth grade students moving on to middle school. These signs are a symbol of a well-earned achievement by students as well as their families and teachers. Congratulations to all.

span.style: font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: The hard working staff at Mesa Verde posted a delightful message on their Facebook page from a parent. The message reads:

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: Every question I have or bump I run into the reply is so so fast and reminds me that I am Nowhere near alone in this. We are once again all done with our work by 11! Parents just to help encourage y’all, my oldest has three different teachers he needs to conference with every week. One is every day. One is two times a week. And the 3rd one is once a week. Plus all the work. Plus my kindergartener.. If I can do this, YOU can do this. If he can do this, they can do this. If you guys need any help please message and I will help as best as I can, along with your amazing teachers that I’m sure are already there.”

span.style: font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: This post is a great reminder that no one in our district is faced with at-home learning alone. If you and your students are in need of support, reach out to fellow parents, teachers, school staff and district staff. Many are finding more and more solid routines as we’ve entered our second month of Continuous Learning and many are willing to help and share tips. We will all get through this together.

span.style: font-size: 20px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

span.span: For many, one level of needed support will be with technology, whether it be laptops or programs students are asked to use. A reminder that parents and students seeking technology assistance can enter a ticket on our website (by clicking

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: ) and using the student's normal computer login information. This is the preferred method of requesting support. A thank you to the Technology Department staff working to keep every student and staff up and running so learning can happen at home.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;

p.span: In closing, let's build on our ethic of caring - for ourselves and for our community. It is through this share support for each other that we will remain #FarmingtonStrong even as we continue #risingtoexcellenceineverypursuit

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px;
font-size: 20px;

a.span: See Something, Say Something: Report Online

div.p: Farmington Municipal Schools does not discriminate nor tolerate harassment on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, genetic information or pregnancy in its educational programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices; and it will take immediate action to eliminate such harassment, prevent its recurrence, and address its effects.
Anyone experiencing any form of discrimination or harassment should contact the Executive Director of Human Resources (505-324-9840) to report the incident.
